questions.question: An alternator is:
options: a. a reversing input switch
b. an AC generator
c. a DC generator
d. a static inverter

questions.question: To prevent high circulating currents between paralleled alternators, the following conditions should be met:
options: a. their voltage and frequency must be the same
b. their frequencies must be identical and their phase sequence must be the same
c. their voltage, frequency, phase and phase sequence must all be the same
d. their inductive and capacitive reactances must match exactly

questions.question: The output of an AC generator is taken from:
options: a. the exciter windings
b. the field coils
c. the stator windings
d. the rotor coils

questions.question: The moving part of an alternator is:
options: a. the rotor
b. the megacycle
c. the stator
d. the frequency

questions.question: A frequency wild alternator must be:
options: a. paralleled
b. a rotating magnet type
c. self-exciting
d. unparalleled

questions.question: In a 3 phase AC generator circuit, the phase voltage is:
options: a. greater than line voltage
b. 10% higher than line voltage
c. less than line voltage
d. equal to line voltage

questions.question: If an alternator output is frequency wild, it would normally be used for:
options: a. flight instruments
b. charging a battery
c. all AC equipment
d. prop and engine de-icing systems

questions.question: The generator output voltage is increased by:
options: a. putting more load on it
b. the frequency controller
c. decreasing the generator field voltage
d. increasing the generator field current

questions.question: A constant frequency AC supply in an aircraft with only frequency wild generators is provided by:
options: a. an inverter
b. a diode
c. an autotransformer
d. a rectifier

questions.question: An alternator normally used to supply an aircraft's power system would be:
options: a. single phase
b. three phase
c. two phase
d. frequency wild

questions.question: A permanent magnet in a rotating field generator:
options: a. provides for initial excitation of the field
b. controls the amount of excitation in the stator windings
c. provides the initial excitation in the voltage regulator
d. can be flashed by the application of alternating current

questions.question: Voltage control of an alternator output is achieved by varying the:
options: a. excitation of the rotating commutator
b. load current
c. excitation of the rotating field
d. power factor

questions.question: Frequency wild AC is produced when:
options: a. a transformer winding open circuits
b. the voltage regulator is malfunctioning
c. the rotational speed of the generator varies
d. the alternator becomes angry

questions.question: In a star connected supply system:
options: a. line and phase current are equal
b. line current is greater than phase current
c. line current is less than phase current
d. phase current is 0.707 times line current

questions.question: In a 3 phase supply system, line voltage would be sensed between the:
options: a. phases only
b. phase and earth
c. phase and neutral
d. phases and earth

questions.question: One advantage of three phase generation over single phase generation is that:
options: a. most aircraft services require a three phase supply
b. it can be more easily transformed into DC
c. it gives more compact generators and allows lower cable weights
d. the power factor is much lower

questions.question: In a typical aircraft constant frequency supply system, the phase voltage is:
An alternator with its output taken from its stationary armature, has:
options: a. a stationary field
b. its field excitation fed directly to the armature
c. AC excitation
d. a rotating field

questions.question: The phase voltage in a star wound three phase system is measured between:
options: a. phase and neutral
b. two phases
c. two lines
d. neutral and earth

questions.question: If one phase of a star wound three phase system becomes earthed, it will:
options: a. earth all three phases
b. cause a large current to flow in the neutral
c. have no effect on the other phases
d. cause a reduction in the frequency of the supply

questions.question: The alternators fitted in an aircraft's main power supply system would normally be:
options: a. brushed self-excited machines
b. frequency wild
c. self-excited
d. externally excited

questions.question: A voltage regulator works by:
options: a. sensing the battery voltage
b. assessing the impedance of the circuit
c. varying the circuit voltage
d. varying the rotating field strength

questions.question: To ensure correct load sharing on paralleled alternators:
options: a. both real and reactive loads should be balanced
b. actual loads should be the same
c. reactive loads should be the same
d. the load impedance should be constant

questions.question: Reactive load sharing is achieved by:
options: a. altering the loads on the bus bars
b. varying the generator rotational speed
c. varying the generator field current
d. altering the CSDU output torque

questions.question: Real load sharing is achieved by:
options: a. varying the alternator rotational speed
b. varying the generator field current
c. altering the loads on the bus bar
d. the voltage regulator

questions.question: The phase relationship of paralleled generators should be:
options: a. unimportant
b. $180^{\circ}$ apart
c. synchronous
d. $120^{\circ}$ apart

questions.question: In a constant speed parallel operation alternator system:
options: a. each alternator has its own constant speed drive unit
b. all engines are run at the same speed
c. all alternators are driven by the same engine
d. engine speed is governed by the constant speed drive unit

questions.question: An aircraft's constant frequency supply is maintained at:
options: a. between 350-450 Hz
b. between 380-420 Hz
c. between 115 -200 Hz
d. between 395-495 Hz

questions.question: For a modern aircraft powered by an AC system, the ground power unit must supply:
options: a. 28 volts AC only
b. 200 volts
c. 115 volts, three phase
d. $115/200$ volts, three phase, 400 Hz

questions.question: Oil for the operation of a CSDU is:
options: a. supplied from the engine oil system
b. a separate self-contained supply
c. drawn from a common tank for all CSDUS
d. only required for lubrication purposes

questions.question: Malfunction of a CSDU requires:
options: a. automatic electrical disconnection of the drive at any time in flight
b. that the input drive will shear on the ground only
c. operation of the drive disconnect switch at any time in flight
d. operation of the drive disconnect switch on the ground only

questions.question: Before two constant frequency AC generators can be connected in parallel:
options: a. their frequency, phase, phase sequence and voltage must match, and a means of automatic real and reactive load sharing must be available
b. real and reactive loads must match. Frequency, phase and voltage must be within limits
c. the synchronization lights on the alternator control panel must be fully bright
d. suitable control arrangements must exist for the sharing of real and reactive loads. These will correct any phase or frequency error existing at the time of connection

questions.question: The generator control relay (GCR) is:
options: a. in the excitation circuit
b. between the alternator and its load bus bar
c. in the stator circuit
d. between the load bus bar and the synchronous bus bar

questions.question: The running excitation current for an alternator is:
options: a. AC
b. DC from the aircraft batteries
c. DC from the static inverter
d. DC which is rectified AC and could be from a separate excitation generator on the main rotor shaft

questions.question: If each phase of a three phase star wound system has a phase voltage of 115 volts, the voltage obtained by bridging two phase would be:
options: a. 200 volts AC
b. 173 volts DC
c. 28 volts DC
d. 173 volts AC

questions.question: Protection from 'earth' faults and 'line to line' faults is given by:
options: a. a negative earth detector
b. a fault protection system including a differential protection monitor
c. the synchronization unit
d. reactive load sharing circuits

questions.question: Warnings of CSDU oil overheat are given in the cockpit by:
options: a. audio warning
b. an 'oil overheat' warning light
c. a 'low oil pressure' warning light
d. a temperature gauge

questions.question: One disadvantage of parallel operation is that:
options: a. faults can propagate, and any error in supply can affect all services
b. the system is less flexible due to the need for additional control and protection circuits
c. the greater load on the CSDUs means that their power / weight ratio is much reduced
d. there is a considerable increase in complexity compared with a non-paralleled system, due to the need for CSDUs and load sharing circuits

questions.question: Alternators in parallel operation require the maintenance of constant frequency and phase synchronization to:
options: a. balance the battery voltage when more than one battery is being used
b. prevent recirculating currents
c. control their voltage
d. reduce their magnetic fields

questions.question: The APU generator can only be used when:
options: a. another generator is on line
b. the aircraft is on the ground
c. the bus bars are being fed from another source
d. when no other power source is feeding the bus bar

questions.question: The purpose of the differential protection circuit in a three phase AC system is:
options: a. to compare alternator output current to bus bar current
b. to compare on and off load currents
c. to compare the alternators reactive load to its real load
d. to compare the CSDU efficiency ratings

questions.question: An alternator driven by a CSDU
options: a. can never be paralleled
b. will require a voltage controller
c. will require a lubrication system separated from its drive oil system
d. will not require a voltage controller

questions.question: In the event of a mechanical malfunction of the alternator:
options: a. the drive disconnect unit will automatically separate the CSDU from the alternator
b. the real load will be adjusted to compensate
c. the quill drive will fracture
d. the CSDU oil temperature will decrease

questions.question: The load meter, upon selection to "kVAR" would indicate:
options: a. total power available
b. reactive loads
c. active loads
d. only DC resistive loads

questions.question: Disconnection of the CSDU in flight would be advisable if:
options: a. the frequency meter indicated a discrepancy of greater than 5 Hz between alternators
b. there was an over or under voltage
c. the oil temperature was high or the oil pressure was low
d. the engine failed

questions.question: To increase the real load taken by a paralleled AC generator, the:
options: a. generator drive torque is increased
b. generator excitation is increased
c. generator drive torque and field excitation are increased
d. generator voltage regulator adjusts the generator rotor torque

questions.question: Load sharing circuits are necessary whenever:
options: a. generators are operating in series
b. generators are operating independently
c. the ground power and the APU are serving the bus bars together
d. generators are operating in parallel

questions.question: Paralleled alternators will have:
options: a. one load meter which measures total system load
b. one voltmeter for each alternator
c. one load meter for each alternator
d. one meter which indicates both voltage and frequency

questions.question: Frequency controlled generators are:
options: a. always paralleled
b. not always paralleled
c. never paralleled
d. paralleled only when the DC is paralleled

questions.question: If the CSDU drive disconnect unit has been used, the drive can:
options: a. only be reconnected when the aircraft is on the ground
b. be reinstated in flight from the electrical supply department
c. be reinstated in flight from the flight deck
d. be reinstated when necessary by using the Ram Air Turbine

questions.question: When selected to 'kW', the alternator load meter will indicate the:
options: a. total circuit load
b. real load
c. reactive load
d. current flowing in the field

questions.question: An AC generator's IDU oil system:
options: a. is self-contained
b. is common with the engine oil system
c. is used only for cooling
d. is used only for lubrication

questions.question: An alternator driven by a non-integrated constant speed drive unit, has windings that are cooled by:
options: a. water
b. oil
c. oil and water
d. air

questions.question: The load in a paralleled AC system is measured in:
options: a. kW & KVA
b. kW & kV
c. KV & KVAR
d. kW & KVAR

questions.question: Paralleled generators must share real and reactive loads:
options: a. to prevent large current flows through the TRUS
b. to prevent out of balance forces being fed through the CSDUs to the engines
c. to prevent large flows of current from one generator to another
d. to prevent harmonic frequencies being created in the synchronous bus bars

questions.question: One advantage of running alternators in parallel is that:
options: a. the supply to all circuits is in phase
b. a large capacity is available to absorb heavy transient loads when switching of heavy currents occurs
c. the risk of overloading the system is reduced
d. there is only a requirement for one CSDU

questions.question: When an external AC supply is feeding the bus bars:
options: a. the internal bus bars are disconnected
b. the aircraft generators are run in parallel with the external supply
c. the aircraft generators are taken off line
d. the synchronizing unit will ensure that no frequency difference exists between the aircraft generators and the external supply

questions.question: A three phase AC system can be used to supply:
options: a. both one or three phase equipment
b. only three phase equipment
c. only single phase equipment
d. only inductive or capacitive loads

questions.question: In a frequency wild generation system:
options: a. generators can be run in parallel only when all engine RPMs match
b. generators can never be run in parallel and there can be no duplication of supply
c. generators can never be run in parallel, but after rectification, the DC can be fed to a common bus bar to provide a redundancy of supply
d. capacitive and inductive loads can be fed with no problems of overheating

questions.question: A fault on one phase of a three phase AC star connected system would:
options: a. have no effect
b. affect only the phase concerned
c. cause inductive loads to overheat
d. affect all three phases

questions.question: The purpose of an inverter is:
options: a. to change AC into DC
b. to change the frequency of the AC supply
c. to act as a back up for the alternator
d. to change DC into AC

questions.question: A low reactive load on one generator is compensated for by:
options: a. altering the excitation current flowing in its field circuit
b. increasing the rotor speed
c. increasing the real load on the other generators
d. overall load reduction

questions.question: In the event of a mechanical failure occurring in the generator, the CSDU is protected by:
options: a. a hydraulic clutch
b. a universal joint
c. a quill drive
d. a feather drive

questions.question: To increase the real load which is being taken by a paralleled alternator:
options: a. the voltage regulator adjusts the generator rotor torque
b. both its drive torque and its excitation are increased
c. only its excitation is increased
d. its drive torque is increased

questions.question: An earth fault on a bus bar of a parallel generator system:
options: a. would require that the appropriate GCB should open
b. would require that the appropriate BTB should open
c. would require that both the appropriate GCB and BTB should open
d. would require that all alternators should operate independently
